### Some packages to help with OpenGL content on Google's go

This organization hosts [`gl`](https://github.com/go-gl/gl) and [`glfw`](https://github.com/go-gl/glfw), two very useful packages for making cross-platform graphics applications. There are some helper libraries such as [`glu`](https://github.com/go-gl/glu) and [`glh`](https://github.com/go-gl/glh), if you want help getting started drawing some basic primitives, using framebuffers or shaders.

A good starting point would be to take a look at the [examples](https://github.com/go-gl/glfw/tree/master/testdata) in glfw project.

### Need help or want to contribute?

Help is always welcome. We can be found on [#go-gl on freenode](http://webchat.freenode.net/?randomnick=1&channels=maria&prompt=1) and are welcome to ask any questions, but you might have to idle a while before getting a response. Graphics help can also be found on #opengl.
